ImageData.summary: The ImageData interface represents the underlying pixel data of an area of a canvas element.

remarks.para: It is created using the constructor or creator methods on the object associated with a canvas: and . It can also be used to set a part of the canvas by using .

ImageDataColorSpace.summary: The read-only ImageData.colorSpace property is a string indicating the color space of the image data.

remarks.para: The color space can be set during ImageData initialization using either the ImageData() constructor or the createImageData() method.

ImageDataColorSpace.value: This property can have the following values:

ImageDataData.summary:
The readonly ImageData.data property returns a
{{jsxref("Uint8ClampedArray")}} or {{jsxref("Float16Array")}} that contains the object's
pixel data. Data is stored as a one-dimensional array in the RGBA order, with integer
values between 0 and 255 (inclusive).
ImageDataData.value: The type depends on the used:

ImageDataHeight.summary:
The readonly ImageData.height property returns the number
of rows in the object.

ImageDataImageData.summary:
The ImageData() constructor returns a newly instantiated
object built from the typed array given and having the
specified width and height.

remarks.para:
This constructor is the preferred way of creating such an object in a
.

-, the creator method that
can be used outside workers.

ImageDataPixelFormat.summary: NOTE Experimental The read-only ImageData.pixelFormat property is a string indicating the pixel format of the image data.

remarks.para: The pixel format can be set during ImageData initialization using either the ImageData() constructor or the createImageData() method.

ImageDataPixelFormat.value: This property can have the following values:

ImageDataWidth.summary:
The readonly ImageData.width property returns the number
of pixels per row in the object.
